title: Profanity Filter always enabled?
body:
Hi!

I have tried a full repair, enabling and disabling BOTH clients, and the profanity filter is always still on.

I can't see anything in game because almost every single word is censored.

Has anyone found a fix for this?

replies.body:
There may be a specific configuration in your local files that's not getting saved.  We've seen a few reports on this, and attempting the following steps might serve as a workaround:

- Close League of Legends
- Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\(lat est version)\deploy\preferences
- Open up the shared(summoner name).PROPERTIES file up with Notepad
- It should say:
[Chat] 
EnableChatFilter=1
- Just change the 1 to a 0. Hit Ctrl+S to save it. 

The steps are a bit advanced, but let me know if you're able to do it and how it works out for you!
These steps resolved the issue for me. I can cuss like a sailor again. Cheers!
Hah, I'm not sure how I feel about that!  Glad it worked out for you, and thanks for helping out!
I tried opening it in notepad, but everything was very unorganized and not formatted, couldn't really change anything.

You can try installing Notepad++ and opening the file with that, https://notepad-plus-plus.org/

Sounds like your version of notepad may be trying to interpret the file differently than expected. 

When opening the shared(summoner name).PROPERTIES file, did you right-click -> Open with or simply double-click the file?

If the latter, attempt instead right-clicking the ...PROPERTIES file and opening it with notepad, should display some pretty simple text, about 4 lines to be exact. Mine looked like: 

1
2
3[Chat]
4EnableChatFilter=0

I had to delete the file, remade the file by logging in, and then changing it.

Your instructions are clear and easy, thanks for the help!
